page.title: 13Woodlands around Cattistock
page.content: There are three privately owned woods of mixed species. An old plantation has been felled and replanted with ash, beech, rowan and hornbeam. Chestnut, sycamore, lime, oak and ash trees predominate throughout the area. In the watermeadows near the river are alder. White willows north of the river give a glow of orange-red colour in late winter. Flowering cherries are numerous around the village and churchyard spectacular in early May. There are several hazel coppices. Chalmington Firs is a small area of conifer plantation. Few hedges have been eradicated, many are ancient. Hazel, blackthorn, elder, bramble, hawthorn, sloe and crabapple are the main components. Some are still laid by hand, but this is very costly. Otherwise they are cut annually by machine.
